What a good party can teach you about the food system: The Brewer’s Plate 2013

12 Apr 2013

As a marketer who works for organizations making systems and sectoral change, I know what it takes to help busy people notice and address big ideas.

Beer.

Craft beer and local sustainable fare to be precise. In a great setting like the CBC Barbara Frum Atrium. Throw in multiple live music live acts, a silent auction and an easy-going crowd and you’ve got a real shot at introducing people to some important ideas.

Enter: The Brewer’s Plate 2013.

Celebrating its 6th year this April 17th, attendees will experience one of the most delectable, convivial and entertaining ways to be introduced to a really dynamic part of Ontario’s food sector.

25 Ontario craft beer makers sharing their work paired with a raft of Ontario’s most creative and conscious chefs and artisans donating their efforts, with proceeds going to Not Far From the Tree.

The chefs range from legends like Chris McDonald (Cava) to a certified B Corp social entrepreneur  Chris Klugman (Paintbox Bistro).

And the Artisans include Chocosol, Evelyn’s crackers, Monforte Dairy, and…what happens if I drool on my keyboard?

You should come.

To whet your appetite, we’ve thrown together a poster illustrating the range of craft beers currently being produced by members of the Ontario Craft Brewers®.

 

Ontario’s burgeoning craft beer industry and hyper-established local sustainable food scene are made up of the kinds of small and medium sized businesses that:

  • Drive our economy (Small and medium sized businesses (like craft breweries) employ 64% of private sector workers in Canada, creating 6.7 million jobs
  • Build community (local ownership does wonders for local investment)
  • Hire more local labour, buy more local goods for resale and buy more services from local businesses than global brands/chains
  • Put in as much as love as they can rather than as little as they can get away with (subjective, but it sure feels true, doesn’t it?)
  • And they give back to local charities, like this year’s Brewer’s Plate beneficiary, Not far From The Tree

But you don’t need to think about all of that right now. You need to buy a ticket for a delectable, convivial and memorable party on April 17th.

About us

Hypenotic is a marketing strategy, design & development firm that chooses to use its powers for good. We’re a certified founding member of B Corp in Canada, and if you don’t know what that is, it’s time you do. Since ’98, we’ve helped a lot of interesting people do important things. We create relevant communications and useful experiences. Find out more.
